avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and cornices have formed in W facing aspects. Beware of unstable wind slabs on steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: There is new snow on W facing aspects after snow fall in strong easterlies and wind slabs and cornices are likely widespread. Little snow was present before but in upper elevations and inland the snow that was present has strengthened after warming and subsequent freezing.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. The most snow has been in North parts and in northerlies earlier this week snow was deposited on souther aspects but over the weekend, loose snow has blown onto north facing aspects. A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. A persistent weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægt vaxandi norðaustanátt, 8-13 síðdegis en lægir á mánudag. Suðvestan 5-13 og lítilsháttar él annað kvöld.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable new snow was added during the weekend and drifted in NE winds. Before there was little snow in the area except for old snowdrift accumulations in gullies and depressions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Since Saturday, considerable snow has been added, first in light wind and then it snowed and drifted in NE wind. Before, there was little snow in the area, on top of either bare ground or old and stable hardpacked snow. Unstable wind slabs may now have formed in gullies and depressions high in mountains, and where old snow accumulated are underneath.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. The most snow has been in North parts and in northerlies earlier this week snow was deposited on souther aspects but over the weekend, loose snow has blown onto north facing aspects. A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. A persistent weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dálítil snjókoma í NA-átt fram á mánudag þegar styttir upp og snýst í allhvassa SV átt. Hæg suðlæg átt og stöku él á þriðjudag. Hlýnar á miðvikudag, með SA átt og rigningu eða slyddu á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Multiple avalanches have released in the area in various aspects. An avalanche released in Burstabrekkudalur 21.1. On 19.1., a large slab avalanche size 2.5 and two smaller ones, one remote triggered released in Burstarbrekkudalur. An avalanche was reported on a S aspect in Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur, Karlsárdalur on Thursday. The avalanche is likely to have released on the interface between older firn and wind slab that formed this week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: At the interface of new snow with older firn, weakness has developed, and faceting has occurred in that layer during the recent frosty days. Significant snowfall in the past week, in various wind directions has formed wind slabs and snow has accumulated on various aspects on top of the weak layer.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant amount of new snow this week with snow blowing onto various aspects. On the interface between new and old snow a widespread weakness is likely to have weakened in cold temperatures and thick wind slabs are overlying this layer in places. Snow pits in the area the last few days have shown this weak layer with facets. Stability tests have given break with low or medium load. Whumpfs and a remote triggered avalanche observed recently indicate a widespread weakness underneath new snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. The most snow has been in North parts and in northerlies earlier this week snow was deposited on souther aspects but over the weekend, loose snow has blown onto north facing aspects. A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. A persistent weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á mánudag norðvestan 5-10 og él en léttir til um kvöldið. Úrkomulítið á þriðjudag og hægur vindur.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few slab avalanches were seen in Eskifjörður, probably released during or after the snowfall on Tuesday, 16.1.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs, that may be unstable, have formed in various aspects the last few days. A weak layer with facets has been found between those and the underlying hardpacked snow.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable snow was added the night before Saturday, especially in the southern part of the forecast area, and drifted in E winds. Before, recent winds slabs were widely, formed in N and W winds, on top of stable hardpacked snow. Between the wind slabs and the hardpacked snow, a weak layer with facets has been found. Snowfall and N wind is forecasted on Sunday evening. The new snow could be unstable and layered wind slabs are expected in most aspects. The weak layer and the wind slabs on top increase the likelihood of human triggered avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. The most snow has been in North parts and in northerlies earlier this week snow was deposited on souther aspects but over the weekend, loose snow has blown onto north facing aspects. A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma í norðanátt sunnudagskvöld og aðfaranótt mánudags. Alhvöss NV-átt á mánudag og styttir upp. Dálítil él á þriðjudag, hlýnar síðdegis á miðvikudag.
